article:
'Dryness' is a property of alcoholic beverages that describes the lack of a
sweet taste. This may be due to a lack of sugars, the presence of some other
taste that masks sweetness, or an underabundance of simple carbohydrates that
can be converted to sugar by enzymes in the mouth (amylase in particular). The
term "dry" may be applied to types of beer, wine, distilled spirits, or any
other form of alcoholic beverage.

In a dry martini the dryness refers to the amount of vermouth used in the
drink. A very dry martini refers to a martini with little or
no vermouth.
